messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Legos and beyond--Ramagon
messages.msgSnippet: There s a kind of building set called Ramagon.  Discovery Toys used to sell them and still might.  They re pricey, but worth it.  Maybe there s a web source?
messages.messageBody:
There's a kind of building set called Ramagon. Discovery Toys used to sell
them and still might. They're pricey, but worth it. Maybe there's a web
source?

We have two sets. They're Lego-compatible, meaning some of the flat surfaces
are made with the lego base-mat mold pattern (Lego guys can stand on them,
you can put Lego pieces on them). You can make space ships for your Lego men.

It's a different kind of construction, with angles, cross pieces, wheels...
hard to describe. I'll look for a link to pictures if they're still being
made.

Sandra

"Everything counts."
http://expage.com/SandraDoddArticles
http://expage.com/SandraDodd
